item.title: WhatsApp to drop support for older Android devices on January 1, 2025 - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
WhatsApp to Drop Support for Older Android Devices on January 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: HD Blog

Meta has announced that it will end support for WhatsApp on devices running Android KitKat and older starting January 1, 2025, affecting users with devices more than 10 years old.

  • Devices that will lose support include:
  • Samsung Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note 2, Galaxy Ace 3, Galaxy S4 Mini
  • Motorola Moto G (1st Gen), Razr HD, Moto E 2014
  • HTC One X, One X+, Desire 500, Desire 601
  • LG Optimus G, Nexus 4, G2 Mini, L90
  • Sony Xperia Z, Xperia SP, Xperia T, Xperia V

Users are advised to back up their WhatsApp data to avoid losing chat history and media after the support ends. Similar measures were previously announced for outdated iPhones.

item.title: Sub-Rs 10,000 category 5G phones set to ring loud and clear in New Year - The Economic Times
item.description:
Affordable 5G Phones Set to Gain Popularity in 2025

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

With the launch of aggressively priced entry-level 5G devices under ₹10,000, 2025 is expected to witness a considerable rise in market penetration of these smartphones across India.

  • Market researcher Counterpoint Research predicts a jump in base 5G smartphone penetration from 3% in 2024 to 43% by the end of 2025.
  • Top brands like Poco and Xiaomi are pushing 5G devices with significant discounts to clear inventories.
  • Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are enhancing 5G adoption, contributing to the surge in device upgrades at the entry level.
  • Overall penetration of sub-₹10,000 smartphones is anticipated to reach 22% in 2025, up from 18% in 2024.
  • 4G phones are expected to continue dominating the entry-level segment with 57% market share.
“100% of new mobile users with budgets above ₹10,000 are buying 5G handsets.” - IIFL Securities

With a combination of affordability and increased access to 5G, 2025 could witness a significant shift in smartphone usage patterns across India.

item.title: 11 Essential Tips I Use to Keep My Android Phone Secure - MUO - MakeUseOf
item.description:
11 Essential Tips I Use to Keep My Android Phone Secure

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

As our phones hold a wealth of personal information, maintaining their security is crucial. This article outlines essential tips for safeguarding your Android device.

  • Avoid connecting to unsecured networks.
  • Regularly review and manage app permissions.
  • Keep Find My Device enabled.
  • Turn on theft detection lock and offline locking.
  • Disable quick settings access on the lock screen.
  • Always use safe browsing mode.
  • Steer clear of suspicious links and attachments.
  • Regularly scan your phone for malware.
  • Secure NFC usage with device unlock requirements.
  • Download apps only from the Play Store and use Google Play Protect.
  • Keep device software up to date.

Keeping a close eye on permissions helps prevent unwanted data collection and enhances privacy.

"Keeping my Android phone secure is a combination of mindful practices and leveraging built-in features."

By following these practices, users can significantly reduce the risks associated with mobile phone security.

item.title: Google TV sneaks in dozens of new free channels for you to skip over - Android Central
item.description:
Google TV Sneaks in Dozens of New Free Channels for You to Skip Over

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: 9to5Google

Google TV now offers over 170 free channels, giving US viewers even more content to explore. This update is available for anyone with the latest Google TV software.

  • Google TV Freeplay app features expanded content options.
  • New channels include various holiday-themed names that may be temporary.
  • Viewers can easily navigate the channels through the 'Live' tab.
“Accessing these channels is super easy. Just head to the 'Live' tab, scroll through your recommendations, or use the Google TV channel player to jump right in.”

This expansion comes after a recent increase from 150 to 171 channels, amidst a constant shuffle of adding and dropping content expected to continue through 2025.

item.title: City planetarium’s new telescopes to bring Mars closer - The Times of India
item.description:
City planetarium’s new telescopes to bring Mars closer

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Not provided

In an exciting development, the city planetarium is upgrading its facilities with new telescopes aimed at providing a closer look at Mars for astronomy enthusiasts and the public.

  • The new telescopes are expected to improve the experience for visitors during Mars observation events.
  • This initiative aims to foster interest in astronomy and space science among locals.
  • The upgrades will include educational programs to teach visitors about Mars and space exploration.
“These new telescopes will not only enhance our capabilities but will also ignite curiosity about the universe among our community.”

The introduction of these new telescopes at the planetarium represents a significant step towards engaging the public in astronomical exploration, particularly with the increasing interest in Mars.

item.title: Proxy advisors call for Rashmi Saluja's ouster from Religare; co backs her | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Proxy Advisors Urge Shareholders to Oust Rashmi Saluja from Religare's Board

Publication Date: N/ASource: Company Business News

Two leading proxy advisory firms have recommended Religare Enterprises investors Ltd (REL) to vote against giving a fresh five-year term on the company's board to chairperson Rashmi Saluja, amidst her ongoing conflict with the company's largest shareholders, the Burman family.

  • Proxy advisory firms are pushing investors to reject Saluja's re-appointment.
  • Her leadership is challenged due to a feud with the Burman family, the largest shareholders.
  • The decision comes as her re-appointment was already uncertain.
“Proxy advisors play a crucial role in shaping corporate governance outcomes,” said an industry expert.

This situation highlights the influence of proxy advisors in corporate governance and raises questions about Saluja's future at Religare.

item.title: Study: ChatGPT & AI Tools Gain Ground In Search Market - Search Engine Journal
item.description:
Study: ChatGPT & AI Tools Gain Ground In Search Market

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Previsible

A new study by Previsible highlights a significant shift in search behavior, where AI tools like ChatGPT and Perplexity are becoming popular alternatives to traditional search engines.

Key Findings

  • Perplexity and ChatGPT account for approximately 37% of LLM referral traffic.
  • The finance sector leads LLM-driven traffic with 84% of total referrals.
  • Content distribution shows that blog posts capture 77.35% of the referral traffic.
David Bell stated, “Google is basically plateaued and has begun to have its search dominance degraded...”

Growth Insights

  • ChatGPT saw a 900% growth in referrals for the events industry over the last 90 days.
  • Finance and e-commerce also reported over 400% growth in traffic from ChatGPT.
Bell further noted, “If you extrapolate out... it can be up to 20% of overall traffic to a website.”

Conclusion

The emergence of AI language models as traffic sources represents a growing trend that could impact the future of search and e-commerce strategies.

item.title: There's Already No Point In The Game Awards 2025 - Screen Rant
item.description:
There's Already No Point In The Game Awards 2025

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: ScreenRant

The article discusses the anticipated dominance of Grand Theft Auto 6 at the Game Awards in 2025, suggesting that its likely success may overshadow other competitors.

  • GTA 6 is forecasted to win multiple awards, causing other titles to struggle for attention.
  • The Most Anticipated Game Award has consistently featured GTA 6 since its announcement.
  • The author argues that this could result in a procession rather than a competitive event.
"If GTA 6 sticks the landing, it could be the biggest game of the 2020s."

The conclusion points to a lack of competition for GTA 6, especially for genres outside traditional award systems, like indie and fighting games.

item.title: Motorola Edge 50 Neo gets a price cut of Rs 9000 on Flipkart: Details here - India TV News
item.description:
Motorola Edge 50 Neo Price Slashed by Rs 9000 on Flipkart

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

The Motorola Edge 50 Neo, a highly-regarded mid-range flagship smartphone, has received a significant price reduction on Flipkart, making it an attractive option for buyers seeking quality at a lower cost.

Key Points:

  • The smartphone's price has dropped from Rs 29,999 to Rs 20,999, a 30% discount totaling Rs 9,000.
  • Flipkart includes additional bank offers such as 5% cashback with Flipkart Axis Bank Credit Card and instant discounts with IDFC Bank cards.
  • Customers can avail of exchange offers up to Rs 20,000 when trading in their old smartphones.
  • The Edge 50 Neo features a 6.4-inch LTPO OLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 7300 chipset, and a triple camera setup including a 50MP primary lens.
  • It is water and dust resistant with an IP68 rating and boasts a 4310mAh battery with 68W fast charging.
“With its stunning display, powerful processor, and professional-grade cameras, this phone is a steal at the current discounted price.”

This price cut on the Motorola Edge 50 Neo offers a remarkable value proposition for smartphone users looking for a reliable and performance-driven device.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Leak: Employees Fired After Images Of Phone Go Viral Ahead Of Its Launch - News24
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Leak: Employees Fired After Images Of Phone Go Viral Ahead Of Its Launch

Date: December 22, 2024   |   Source: News24

Samsung is preparing to launch its Galaxy S25 series in January 2025. Recently, leaked images of the devices caused significant issues for the company, leading to the termination of several employees involved in the leak.

The leak has given a glimpse into the S25 series, which includes the Ultra, S25+, and the standard S25 models. The images surfaced on social media, leading to swift action from Samsung.

  • Images of Samsung's Galaxy S25 series leaked online.
  • Employees responsible for the leak have been fired.
  • The leaked images included visible device identification numbers.
  • Leaker Evan Blass confirmed details about the S25 Ultra and S25+.
  • The launch event is scheduled for January 2025.
"The leak of any upcoming project from the IT industry is a nightmare for the company."

This incident emphasizes the risks and challenges of information leaks in the tech industry, potentially dampening consumer anticipation.

item.title: Global VR Headset Shipments to Hit 9.6 Million in 2024 as Meta Leads - PCMag
item.description:
Global VR Headset Shipments to Hit 9.6 Million in 2024 as Meta Leads

Publication Date: 2023

Source: TrendForce

Global shipments of VR and mixed reality (MR) headsets are expected to reach approximately 9.6 million units in 2024, representing an 8.8% increase compared to 2023, with Meta leading the market share.

  • Meta holds a 73% market share in 2024 due to the affordability of the Quest 3S headset.
  • Sony's PS VR2 has a 9% market share but is facing a decline in shipments due to integration issues.
  • Apple's Vision Pro accounts for 5% of the market, introducing new features that may influence future product directions.
  • TrendForce highlights a shift towards VR headsets as multi-functional productivity tools.
“The release of the Vision Pro may be set to have a big influence on the VR space.”

Looking ahead, Apple is expected to pursue a strategy of releasing both budget and high-end VR headsets to broaden its market presence.

item.title: OnePlus Watch 3 Launch Date Confirmed, Could Debut With LTE Connectivity; Check Expected Specs - Zee News
item.description:
OnePlus Watch 3 Launch Date Confirmed, Could Debut With LTE Connectivity; Check Expected Specs

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Zee News

The Chinese electronics brand is gearing up to unveil the OnePlus Watch 3 smartwatch on January 7, 2024, alongside the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R smartphones. The smartwatch is anticipated to feature significant upgrades over its predecessor.

  1. The OnePlus Watch 3 will have a rotating crown for improved navigation.
  2. Expected to include heart rate sensor and ECG functionality, regionally limited.
  3. Powered by Snapdragon W5 Gen 1 SoC with 2GB RAM and 32GB storage.
  4. Will run on Watch OS 5 and RTOS.
  5. Battery capacity exceeding 500 mAh, promising substantial longevity.
  6. Some versions expected to support LTE connectivity for calls and messaging.
  7. The series is targeting the high-end market with premium features.
"The OnePlus Watch 3 represents a significant step forward in the company's smartwatch lineup."

The OnePlus Watch 3 is set to compete with premium devices from brands like Apple and Samsung, offering advanced health tracking and other notable features.

item.title: New leak says if your iPhone can run iOS 18, it should be able to run iOS 19 too - TechRadar
item.description:
New Leak Suggests iOS 19 Compatibility for iPhones Running iOS 18

Date: [Insert publication date] Source: TechRadar

This article discusses new information suggesting that iPhones capable of running iOS 18 will also be able to upgrade to iOS 19. It highlights the potential compatibility issues with iPads and notes that official announcements are expected in June 2025.

  • The same iPhones on iOS 18 may also get iOS 19
  • One iPad model set to be dropped with iPadOS 19
  • Expect official news sometime in June 2025
“Not all the new iOS 19 features will be available on all iPhones.”

In conclusion, while many devices are set to receive the updates, there will be limitations based on hardware capabilities.

item.title: Apple iOS 18.2.1 Update Likely To Arrive In Late December For iPhone Users With Bug Fixes - Zee News
item.description:
Apple iOS 18.2.1 Update Likely To Arrive In Late December For iPhone Users With Bug Fixes

Date: Recent report
Source: MacRumors

Introduction: Apple is nearing the release of iOS 18.2.1, a minor update for iPhone users focused primarily on bug fixes and enhancing device stability. The update is expected to roll out in late December or early January.

  • iOS 18.2.1 is currently in internal testing stages.
  • The update is designed to address ongoing security vulnerabilities.
  • iOS 18.2 introduced features like Genmoji and integration of ChatGPT with Siri.
  • The Find My app now allows sharing the location of AirTag-equipped baggage with select airlines.
  • iOS 18.3 is also in development but is not expected to bring significant changes.
"iOS 18.2.1 is anticipated to enhance overall stability and performance for users running iOS 18.2."

Conclusion: The upcoming iOS 18.2.1 update highlights Apple's commitment to improving user experience by focusing on security and performance enhancements.

item.title: iOS 18.2: How to Use Genmoji and Apple Intelligence to Create Custom Emoji - CNET
item.description:
iOS 18.2: How to Use Genmoji and Apple Intelligence to Create Custom Emoji

Publication Date: December 11, 2023 Source: CNET

Apple has released iOS 18.2, a significant update that introduces new features, including Genmoji, allowing users to create custom emojis using Apple Intelligence.

  • The update focuses on enhancing user experience on iPhone 15 Pro, Pro Max, and the iPhone 16 lineup.
  • Users can create their own emojis without waiting for the Unicode Standard approvals.
  • To use Genmoji, Apple Intelligence needs to be enabled in the iPhone settings.
  • Step-by-step instructions on how to create a custom emoji include using the Messages app and typing a description of the desired emoji.
“Now you don't have to wait for the Unicode Standard to propose, create and bring new emoji to devices.”

The release of iOS 18.2 not only updates the operating system but also empowers users with new creative tools like Genmoji, making emoji communication more personalized and immediate.

item.title: Has it become difficult to spend the day without a mobile? - ఇండియా హెరాల్డ్ గ్రూప్ అఫ్ పబ్లిషర్స్ ప్రై లిమిటెడ్ - India Herald Group of Publishers P LIMITED
item.description:
Has it become difficult to spend the day without a mobile?

Date: October 2023, Source: Unknown

Over 50 years after the first mobile phone call, the significance of smartphones in daily life has escalated dramatically. Today, more people have mobile phones than those without.

  • The first mobile phone call was made by Martin Cooper on April 3, 1973.
  • IBM released the first smartphone, Simon, in 1994, which had shortcomings like poor battery life.
  • As of 2023, 54% of the global population, approximately 4.3 billion individuals, own smartphones.
  • 4.6 billion people globally use mobile internet, with 4 billion accessing it through smartphones.
  • The GSMA's report highlights the use of different types of mobile phones for internet access worldwide.
  • 69% of smartphone users access the internet via 4G technology.
"According to GSMA's 'State of Mobile Internet Connectivity Report 2023', more than half of the world's population has smartphones."

The smartphone has transformed communication and connectivity, becoming essential in various aspects of everyday life.

item.title: Apple Maps Web Rolls Out New Feature Akin To Google's Street View 360 Degree, Here's What We Know - ABP Live
item.description:
Apple Maps Introduces 360-Degree Look Around Feature

Publication Date: December 11, 2023 Source: 9to5Mac

Apple Maps is enhancing its functionality with the new 'Look Around' feature, which provides 360-degree panoramic views similar to Google Street View.

  • The 'Look Around' feature is rolling out across various cities in the US, Canada, Australia, the UK, and the EU.
  • This feature was previously available on the iPhone app since iOS 13 and is now accessible on the Apple Maps web app.
  • Apple Maps web still lacks some advanced functionalities found on mobile, like 3D buildings.
  • Additional features and updates are expected in the future.
"Look Around is being progressively rolled out to additional regions, enhancing the mapping experience for users across various platforms."

In conclusion, the introduction of the 'Look Around' feature marks a significant step in improving the Apple Maps web experience, now bringing it closer to the functionality offered by competitors like Google Maps.

item.title: 5 Best Gaming Phones Under Rs 35000 In December 2024 - Times Now
item.description:
5 Best Gaming Phones Under Rs 35000 In December 2024

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Times Now Digital

This article reviews the best gaming phones available in India for under Rs 35000 in December 2024, focusing on their features and pricing.

  • Samsung Galaxy A55: Priced at Rs 32,999, features a 6.6-inch Super AMOLED display and 5000 mAh battery.
  • Vivo V40: Starting at Rs 33,888, includes a 6.78-inch AMOLED HDR 10+ display and 5500 mAh battery.
  • Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus: Costs Rs 30,999 with a 6.67-inch display and 6200 mAh battery.
  • OnePlus Nord 4: Available for Rs 27,999, offers a 6.74-inch AMOLED display and 5500 mAh battery.
  • iQOO Neo 9 Pro: Priced at Rs 33,999, features a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate.
“These phones combine performance and affordability, making them ideal for gaming enthusiasts looking for value in December 2024.”

All the mentioned devices promise high performance for casual and serious gamers, maintaining a good battery life and features suitable for gaming.
